keyword: how many calories are in banana nut bread
title: How Many Calories Are in Banana Nut Bread?
meta_description: Discover how many calories are in banana nut bread per slice, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition breakdowns with easy tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in Banana Nut Bread?
assumptions: Standard homemade slice (~65 g), made with mashed bananas, walnuts, flour, sugar, eggs, and butter; baked without added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, ingredients (e.g., nut type, sugar amount), and baking method. Check labels for store-bought versions.

quick_answer.text: One slice of banana nut bread typically contains about 250 kcal, with good amounts of carbs and healthy fats from nuts.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use applesauce instead of butter for lower fat
Add 1 tbsp chocolate chips per slice

faqs.q: How many calories are in banana nut bread per slice?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal for a standard 65 g slice.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in banana nut bread?
faqs.a: About 30 g carbs per slice, including 1.5 g fiber and 15 g sugars from bananas and added sweeteners.

faqs.q: Is banana nut bread high in protein?
faqs.a: Moderately; one slice has around 4 g protein, mainly from nuts and eggs.

faqs.q: How does store-bought banana nut bread compare?
faqs.a: Often higher in calories (300+ kcal/slice) due to extra sugar, preservatives, and larger portionsâ€”check the label.

faqs.q: Can I make banana nut bread lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, substitute butter with yogurt or reduce sugar; this can cut 40-50 kcal per slice.
